alert.note: Alert for Franklin; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 5:31PM CDT until April 15 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Franklin County in east central Missouri... Southwestern St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 531 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Gray Summit, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chesterfield, Wildwood, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Crestwood, Town and Country, Eureka, Ellisville, Sunset Hills, Des Peres, Pacific, Valley Park, Weldon Spring, Fenton, Frontenac, Clarkson Valley, and Oakland. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 251 and 277. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Route 66 State Park, and Castlewood State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Missouri.
